item.description:
Not going away for the holiday weekend? There's plenty of fun things to do in town. . . like joining us for a somewhat impromptu, last-minute dinner at this neighborhood gem in East Arlington. And eating at a restaurant that is essentially a one-of-a-kind, one-woman show seemed the perfect follow-up to our recent viewing of "Julie and Julia."

Prose's chef-owner Debbie Shore is creative, inspired, and totally unpredictable so we never have any idea what to expect when we go there. . . but we know it will be incredibly good. And it will probably be locally grown/farmed/raised. And there won't be a huge wine list but what is there will be carefully chosen to bring out the best in each item on the menu.

Slight warning: this is a restaurant for people who care more about good food and good company than they do about good service. When you are dealing with a one-person-show, you sort of have to go with the experience and not expect waitpersons to anticipate your every wish.

Sorry, no Maybe RSVPs. . . not enough time for them.

As usual, your $2 reservation fee will be added to the tip for our table.
item.name: End-of-summer dinner at Prose, Arlington
